compat: use STDIN_FILENO over 0

This is already used throughout this file, and is self-documenting.

events.body:

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26809#pullrequestreview-1235788141), [kristapsk](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26809#pullrequestreview-1235811575), [aureleoules](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26809#pullrequestreview-1235836735), [john-moffett](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26809#issuecomment-1370946141), [achow101](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26809#issuecomment-1371500165) |
| Concept ACK | [murrayn](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26809#issuecomment-1370872954) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
ACK 585c6722128537f772043ef4c87238e283669b8a, I have reviewed the code and it looks OK, I agree it can be merged.

I don't think this is compatible with Windows. `STDIN_FILENO` is defined in `unistd.h`. [MSDN](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/c-runtime-library/reference/fileno?redirectedfrom=MSDN&view=msvc-170) suggests to use `_fileno(stdin)` for Windows instead.
ACK 585c672, my initial concern was with WIN32, but the code block is explicitly not WIN32.

> I don't think this is compatible with Windows.

The code is in a non-windows block.

> > I don't think this is compatible with Windows.
> 
> The code is in a non-windows block.

Yes, sorry, missed that.
